comments:
Hi,

I am trying to remote debug an OpenOffice Java Component from eclipse 3.1.

I start OO with the following parameters in user/config/java.ini

-Xdebug
-Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,address=8000,suspend=n

From eclipse I can connect to OO, "netstat -a" reports for example

  TCP    BOX:1073              localhost:8000         ESTABLISHED
  TCP    BOX:8000              localhost:1073         ESTABLISHED

But as soon as I set a breakpoint inside the source code, 
the connection is *terminated* :-(

It is also not possible to establish a connection if any breakpoints
are set before, the connection is terminated immediately ...

I used Java 1.5_04 and 1.4.2_08, seems not to make a difference ...

the remote connection feature was working some month ago with 
a *prior* eclipse version ...

regards

Oliver

Works for me launching Eclipse with the exact same command line parameters. I 
can attach, set a breakpoint, or set a breakpoint and attach. Does it work 
with other applications?

Hi,

seems to be the same bug as described in
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=98708

so I don't think it's a java/OO problem ...

I will try to use eclipse 3.0 to verify ...

Oliver

Hi,

> I will try to use eclipse 3.0 to verify ...

same problem with eclipse *3.0.1*,
I do not have a 3.0 version any more ...

Oliver

Oliver

Hi,

meanwhile I know what went wrong:

some days ago I updated to a new version of zonealarm (zlsSetup_60_631_002.exe)
no problems so far with email/internet, but any attempt to remote debug my
programms leads to the described errors ...

sorry ...

Oliver

re-opening to change resolution. Since nothing was fixed in the SDK, we will 
mark as invalid.
